TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Annotation extends System.Object implements class System.Xml.Serialization.IXmlSerializable

Docs.summary: Represents a user annotation in the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_caf](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-caf-md.md)].

remarks.format:
## Remarks Annotation represents a single annotation with all associated anchoring and content data. An annotation consists of the following main elements.
- Zero, one, or more <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors%2A> that identify what is being annotated.
- Zero, one, or more <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos%2A> that contain the user data for the annotation.
- Zero, one, or more <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Authors%2A> that define who created the annotation.
- A <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.CreationTime%2A> that specifies the date and time when the annotation was created.
- A <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.LastModificationTime%2A> that specifies when the annotation was last updated.
- A unique annotation <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Id%2A> (a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_guid](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md)]).

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: This constructor supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wpf](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-wpf-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > Applications should not use the default constructor without parametersâ€“the default constructor does not fully initialize the instance. To create a new <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> applications should use one of the parameter-based constructors.

Docs.param: The type name of the annotation.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class that has a specified type name and namespace.

Docs.param: The type name of the annotation.
The date and time the annotation was first created.
The date and time the annotation was last modified.
Docs.summary: This constructor supports the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wpf](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-wpf-md.md)] infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > This constructor is used by the [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_wpf](~/add/includes/tlasharptla-wpf-md.md)] serialization infrastructure and should not be used directly under ordinary circumstances.

Docs.summary: Occurs when an anchor is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Anchors%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In addition to when an anchor is added or removed, AnchorChanged occurs on any modifications to an anchor subpart, such as a change to a <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.ContentLocatorPart>.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of zero or more anchor elements that define the data selection(s) being annotated.
Docs.value: A collection of zero or more anchor elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource> in the Anchors collection identifies a data selection to which the annotation is bound (in other words, "the data selection that is being annotated"). While most annotations refer to a single data selection and contain just one anchor <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource>, multiple anchors can occur if a single annotation refers to multiple data selections.
The returned Anchors collection is never null; however, the collection may contain zero elements.

Docs.summary: Gets the <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> of the annotation type.
Docs.value: The XML qualified name for this kind of annotation.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The returned annotation type is the <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> name passed as a parameter to the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.%23ctor%2A> constructor.
> [!NOTE] > AnnotationType returns `null` if the annotation was incorrectly constructed by using a default constructor without parameters. (The default constructor without parameters does not fully initialize the instance and is used only internally in combination with XML serialization.) To create a new annotation, applications should use the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.%23ctor%2A> constructor that takes an <xref:System.Xml.XmlQualifiedName> as a parameter.

Docs.summary: Occurs when an author is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Authors%2A>.
Gets a collection of zero or more author strings that identify who created the .
Docs.value: A collection of zero or more author strings.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The returned Authors collection is never `null`; however, the collection can contain zero elements if no author is specified.

Docs.summary: Occurs when a cargo is added, removed, or modified in the list of annotation <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation.Cargos%2A>.

remarks.format: ## Remarks In addition to when a cargo is added or removed, CargoChanged occurs on any modification to a cargo subpart, such as a change to an <xref:System.Xml.XmlElement> in the <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource.Contents%2A> collection of a cargo.

Docs.summary: Gets a collection of zero or more cargo elements that contain data for the annotation.
Docs.value: A collection of zero or more cargo elements.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Each <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.AnnotationResource> in the Cargos collection contains user-defined data for the annotation.
The returned Cargos collection is never null; however, the collection may contain zero elements if there is no user data for the annotation.

Docs.summary: Gets the date and the time that the annotation was created.
Docs.value: The date and the time the annotation was created.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > CreationTime returns <xref:System.DateTime?displayProperty=fullName> if the annotation was incorrectly created by using the default <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> constructor without parameters. An <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> constructor with parameters should be used to correctly instantiate a new annotation.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Xml.Schema.XmlSchema GetSchema() cil managed

Docs.summary: Always returns . See [Annotations Schema](~/add/includes/ajax-current-ext-md.md) for schema details.
Docs.returns: Always . See [Annotations Schema](../Topic/Annotations%20Schema.md) for schema details.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > Id returns <xref:System.Guid> if the annotation was instantiated by using the default <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> constructor without parameters. An <xref:System.Windows.Annotations.Annotation> constructor with parameters should be used to correctly instantiate a new annotation with a valid [!INCLUDE[TLA2#tla_guid](~/add/includes/tla2sharptla-guid-md.md)].

Docs.summary: Gets the date and the time that the annotation was last modified.
Docs.value: The date and the time the annotation was last modified.

Docs.exception: The serialized XML for the is not valid.

Docs.param: The XML writer to use to serialize the annotation.
Docs.summary: Serializes the annotation to a specified <xref:System.Xml.XmlWriter>.
